I think a hot mist humidifier is safer and more effective than a cool mist humidifier. Since hot mist humidifiers boil the water before releasing it. Killing bacteria and mold spores. Cool mist humidifiers have been known to cause a condition called humidifier fever.

For cough and cold I like the old OTC combination of dextromethorphan (cough suppressant). And Guaifenesin (mucolytic). Which thins out mucus, and makes it easier to cough up.

Antibiotics don't kill viruses. But viruses often cause secondary **bacterial** pneumonia. And that's usually what kills people. So if you need antibiotic prophylaxis make sure you get it.

During the HIN1 pandemic, people died when they were just given antivirals and sent home. When they should have received antibiotic prophylaxis for bacterial pneumonia. I think the jury is still out as to whether antivirals are little more than a placebo.

Older people can boost their immunity by including a couple of extra hard boiled eggs. Or other complete quality protein, with a multivitamin. Research has shown that you can increase an older person's vaccination titer. By adding a few hard boiled eggs to their diet. Works for young people too.
